home.tagline: "I have read and agree to the Terms" is the biggest lie on the web. Together, we can fix that.
home.how_it_works.title: How it works
home.how_it_works.content.one: ToS;DR aims to provide easy-to-understand summaries of Privacy Policies and Terms of Service through a transparent and peer-reviewed process.
home.how_it_works.content.two: Terms of service are reviewed by volunteer contributors, who highlight small points that we can discuss, compare and ultimately assign a score: "good", "neutral", "bad", and scariest of all, "blocker".
home.how_it_works.content.three: Once a service has enough points to assess the fairness of their terms, we use a formula to provide ratings from Grade A to Grade E:
home.how_it_works.a: The terms of service treat you fairly, respect your rights, and will not abuse your data.
home.how_it_works.b: The terms of service are fair towards the user but they could be improved.
home.how_it_works.c: The terms of service are okay but some issues need your consideration.
home.how_it_works.d: The terms of service are very uneven, or there are some important issues that need your attention.
home.how_it_works.e: The terms of service raise very serious concerns.
home.how_it_works.none: Not enough information exists to accurately grade this service yet.
home.how_it_works.more_info.before: Right now you will notice that many services do not yet have a grade assigned. This is where you come in! Help us
home.how_it_works.more_info.after: so that we may increase our coverage.
footer.about_text: "Terms of Service; Didn't Read" (short: ToS;DR) is a project started in June 2012 to help fix the "biggest lie on the web": almost no one really reads the terms of service we agree to all the time.
error.title: Error %d
thanks.intro: We would like to express our gratitude to the following sponsors who help make ToS;DR possible:
thanks.independence.title: Sponsorship Independence Disclosure
thanks.independence.text: While we are grateful for our sponsors' support, ToS;DR's ratings and reviews remain completely independent from any sponsorship. Our assessment process is transparent and community-driven, ensuring unbiased evaluations of terms of service and privacy policies.
thanks.independence.link: Read our full Sponsorship Independence Disclosure
new_service.title: Add New Service
new_service.description: Please provide the details of the service you would like to add to ToS;DR. Our team will review your submission.
new_service.email_help: If added, we will E-Mail you if your request gets accepted or denied.
new_service.note_help: Add any additional information that might be helpful for reviewing this service.
graded_services.title: Services with Grade %s
translation.warning: The points above have been machine translated. They may not be 100% accurate and we encourage you to check the original point to verify accuracy.
no_grade.warning: This summary has not been completed and information is probably missing. You can help us finish this summary by contributing.
donate.header_text: Help us keep ToS;DR free and open source by donating to our project.
donate.banner.title: It's funding month! ðŸŒŸ
donate.banner.description: ToS;DR is a not-for-profit, FOSS project that depends on donations to keep running. If everyone reading this donated just $1, we'd be funded for the next few years!
donate.title: Donate to ToS;DR
donate.intro: Support our mission by donating via OpenCollective or through cryptocurrency! ToS;DR has been dedicated to making terms of service and privacy policies more transparent since 2012. Your donation helps us continue our work, maintain our independence, and improve our tools. Every contribution, no matter the size, makes a difference. Join us in our mission to create a fairer internet!
donate.opencollective.description: Support us through OpenCollective, a transparent funding platform for open source projects.
donate.opencollective.methods: Supported payment methods: Credit Card, PayPal, or bank transfer.
donate.githubsponsors.description: Support us through GitHub Sponsors, a platform for open source projects.
donate.crypto.title: Donate via Crypto
donate.crypto.description: If you prefer a more private way to support us, consider donating using various cryptocurrencies. Below are our wallet addresses along with QR codes for easy transactions.
donate.crypto.disclaimer: Please only send cryptocurrencies using their respective networks (e.g., Bitcoin only using the Bitcoin network, Ethereum only using the Ethereum network, etc.). We are not responsible for any loss of funds due to incorrect network usage.
